class_notes: This course will explore current evidence relating diet, nutrition, and the food environment to promoting health and preventing disease. The focus will be on digestive health, obesity type 2 diabetes, cardiovascular disease, bone health, and cancer. Students will learn about diet and related factors that increase or decrease risk of these conditions, evaluate evidence, and compare intervention strategies. (Prerequisite: HLTH 220)
course_description: Nutrition and Chronic Disease provides an overview of the role of nutrition in chronic disease prevention, development and treatment.
prerequisites: HLTH 220 or equivalent transfer credit as a prerequisite
sections: Class Nbr: 3498, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: MW 11:30a-12:45p, Instructor: J. Welsh, Status: Open
